definition: to give up/to abandon/to give alms

sentences.english: She lives in an apartment with four other roommates.
sentences.chinese: 和另外四个舍友同住一个宿舍。

sentences.english: As we entered a room, my roommate opened her books and began to work on the homework.
sentences.chinese: 我们进了一个房间之后，我舍友就打开书开始做练习。

sentences.english: Your roommate, Maggie is good at writing and I believe she could help you.
sentences.chinese: 你舍友，玛姬很擅长写作，我想她可以帮你。

sentences.english: So are these roommates headed for a best friend relationship?
sentences.chinese: 这看上去像是能发展成一段最佳友谊的舍友关系吗？

sentences.english: In a word, strengthening the communications between roommates conduces to a harmonious relationship.
sentences.chinese: 一句话，增强舍友间的交流有助于发展和谐的关系。

sentences.english: I had a roommate to use this, look at her hair straight point.
sentences.chinese: 我原本一舍友就用的这个，看着她头发直了点了。

sentences.english: Last year, I remember when one of my roommates met her Romeo.
sentences.chinese: 我还记得往年当我的一个舍友碰到她的罗密欧的情景。

sentences.english: One of flatmate is a welsh girl called anna.
sentences.chinese: 我有个舍友是威尔士的女孩子叫安娜。

sentences.english: When you are in BJU, forgive your roommates’ donkey act.
sentences.chinese: 当你还在学校的时候，多原谅舍友的小过失。

sentences.english: There's a Ghanaian in the crowd with his German roommate.
sentences.chinese: 在这群人当中还有一个加纳人和他的德国舍友。

sentences.english: My roommate is considerate and I get along well with her?
sentences.chinese: 我的舍友非常体贴，我跟她相处的很好。

sentences.english: Not only does she easily accept her classmates' opinion, but she is also polite.
sentences.chinese: 她不仅很容易接受舍友的意见，而且还很礼貌。

sentences.english: Another one of my roommates was not as fortunate.
sentences.chinese: 我的另一个舍友就没有这么幸运了。

sentences.english: Back to the dormitory, roommates Hula what gather around asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 回到宿舍，舍友们呼啦一下聚过来问东问西。

sentences.english: Such behaviors will hurt the relationships between you and your roommates.
sentences.chinese: 这种行为会伤害到你与舍友之间的关系。

definition: to study at the same school/fellow student/classmate/CL:位[wei4],個|个[ge4]
(coll.) (a woman's) close female friend/bestie/(originally written 閨密|闺密, an abbr. for 閨中密友|闺中密友)
to be in the same class/to be in the same squad/classmate
